result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall J Lehman Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $250 plus costs including the Domestic Abuse Surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Do not possess any dangerous weapons.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regard to alcohol and controlled substances. 
Do not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No abusive contact with Ms. Prahl which does include no verbal and physical abuse.

Complete the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program. 
Participate in other counseling as recommended by the agent. 
Write a letter of apology to the victim, Ms. Prahl, provide to agent to forward.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 2.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Randall J Lehman Sr in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:17 AM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

Defendant will plead to Count 2 and Count 4.
Count 1 and Count 3 would be dismissed and read in.

Atty Molepske states the plea agreement.
Atty Redfield concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 2: NO CONTEST
Count 4: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Redfield for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
Victim notification statutes are complied with.

Victim is present, does not wish to make a statement.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
Count 2: Misdemeanor Battery - Domestic
Count 3: Dismissed and Read In
Count 4: Disorderly Conduct - Domestic

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court.
Atty Redfield makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court believes the plea agreement is appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Count 2:
6 Month Jail Sentence, Imposed and Stayed
1 Day Jail Credit if probation is revoked
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $250 plus costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
AODA assessment and comply with recommendations
Maintain absolute sobriety with regard to alcohol and controlled substances
Do not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription
Complete the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program
Participate in other counseling as recommended by the agent
Do not possess any dangerous weapons
Write a letter of apology to victim, Ms. Prahl, provide to agent to forward
No abusive contact with Ms. Prahl which does include no verbal and physical abuse

Count 4:
30 Day Jail Sentence, Imposed and Stayed, consecutive to Count 2
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 2
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 2
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge

Any bond posted is to be applied to fines and costs
Plea hearing on March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Randall J Lehman Sr in court with attorney Jared C. Redfield. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 4, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Randall J Lehman Sr in court with attorney Jared C. Redfield. Intern Krause w/Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond is continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
CAP Services Family Safety Plan with Consent to Contact filed by: Pamela Prahl

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *Pamela Prahl  *Unless a written request  from the victim and a Family Safety Plan is filed with the District Attorney and the Clerk of Courts.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.

DA Louis Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Atty Jared Redfield appears in Court. 

DA Molepske states facts for anticipated charges of Battery (Domestic), DC (Domestic), Strangulation/Suffocation.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court advises of attorney privileges.  
Atty Redfield has been retained.
State requests a $1,500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Redfield makes bond arguments to the Court. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  7/21/14  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
